title: Radhika Yadav murder: Village taunts over daughter's reels fuelled father's rage, reveals probe
content: Radhika Yadav's pursuit of a coaching career and social media presence reportedly fueled tensions with her father, Deepak, who had invested heavily in her tennis aspirations. Villagers' comments on her online activity allegedly exacerbated Deepak's disapproval, leading to frequent arguments.

title: 'Tried to kill me': Mob attacks ex-Cong leader's office; gunman fires in air
content: Suspended Congress MLC Teenmaar Mallanna alleges an assassination attempt orchestrated by Telangana Jagruthi members at BRS MLC K Kavitha's instigation, following his remarks about her. Mallanna's security guard fired in self-defense as protesters stormed his office, prompting a police complaint.

title: 'Height to hai hi nahi': How Siraj convinced Gill for DRS - WATCH
content: Mohammed Siraj's confidence and fiery spells were instrumental on Day 4 of the third Test at Lord's. His conviction led to a successful DRS review, dismissing Ollie Pope after trapping him plumb in front. Earlier, Siraj had removed Ben Duckett, fueled by lingering tension from the previous day, as India seized momentum.

title: Top engineer quits Elon Musk’s AI firm: Joins OpenAI; says ‘Jensen Huang was right…’
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: Gaza death toll passes 58,000; ceasefire talks drag on
content: The Palestinian death toll in Gaza has surpassed 58,000 since the war's onset 21 months ago, with a significant number being women and children. Recent Israeli airstrikes resulted in at least 19 fatalities, including six children at a water collection point, amidst stalled ceasefire negotiations.

title: US-EU tariff tensions: EU extends suspension of countermeasures to August
content: Ursula von der Leyen announced the EU will extend the suspension of retaliatory tariffs on US steel and aluminum until early August, amidst ongoing negotiations to avert broader 30% duties threatened by the US.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Pant should share match fees with Jurel' - Ex-India keeper makes hilarious remark
content: During the India versus England Test at Lord's, Dhruv Jurel substituted for an injured Rishabh Pant. Jurel's wicket-keeping skills drew attention. Dinesh Karthik jokingly suggested Pant should share his match fees with Jurel. India scored 387, with KL Rahul's century and Pant's fifty. Fans await updates on Pant's injury. The match remains tightly contested.

title: Goldman Sachs hires employee that could be a 'nightmare' for engineering graduates
content: Goldman Sachs is set to revolutionize its software development by integrating Devin, an AI software engineer, aiming to enhance productivity and automate routine tasks. This move signals a significant shift in the financial industry's labor dynamics, potentially impacting entry-level positions as AI coders become integral to the workforce.

title: Language row: Auto driver slapped by Uddhav Sena workers over 'anti-Marathi' remark
content: A video showing Shiv Sena (UBT) workers assaulting an auto-rickshaw driver in Palghar for allegedly insulting the Marathi language and icons has gone viral. The driver was forced to apologize publicly. The incident follows a similar action by MNS workers against a food stall owner for not speaking Marathi, highlighting tensions over language use in Maharashtra.

title: AI171 crash report: ICPA slams 'pilot suicide theory'
content: Following the preliminary report on the AI 171 incident, the India Commercial Pilots' Association (ICPA) has strongly condemned the baseless rumors of pilot suicide. The ICPA emphasizes the rigorous screening and training pilots undergo, denouncing the insinuation as unethical and insensitive. They urge respect for the ongoing investigation and support for the crew, who acted responsibly under difficult circumstances.

title: Watch: Women clash on bus over mobile charger slot
content: A dispute over a mobile charging point on a bus in Kanpur escalated into a physical fight between two women, Parul Singh and Renu Vishwakarma. The altercation prompted police intervention, with an officer chasing the bus to restore order. Ultimately, both women were fined for disturbing the peace after the incident near the Armapur canal.

title: Why X CEO Linda Yaccarino and 14 other executives may have just quit
content: Linda Yaccarino resigned as CEO of X amidst turmoil in Elon Musk's empire, marked by high-profile departures across Tesla, SpaceX, and X. Fourteen senior leaders have exited in the past year, citing disagreements over strategy, political focus, and internal tensions. The departures raise concerns about Musk's ability to retain talent as his ventures intertwine with political ambitions.

title: Arizona resident dies from pneumonic plague; know about the disease
content: A resident of Northern Arizona's Coconino County succumbed to pneumonic plague, marking the first such death since 2007. Health officials confirmed the rare but deadly lung infection, caused by Yersinia pestis, can spread through respiratory droplets. Symptoms include fever, cough, and chest pain, with rapid deterioration possible.

title: Watch: Siraj gives Duckett a fiery send-off as tensions boil over at Lord’s
content: Mohammed Siraj ignited Day 4 of the Lord's Test by dismissing Ben Duckett, celebrating aggressively in response to simmering tensions between India and England. This followed Zak Crawley's time-wasting tactics on Day 3, which angered Shubman Gill and the Indian team. Siraj's fiery celebration underscored India's renewed aggression and determination to capitalize on Duckett's early dismissal.

title: 'Friendship is done': Swift unlikely to forgive Blake Lively after betrayal
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship faces trouble. Sources say they are not in contact. This follows Lively's connection to Justin Baldoni's legal issues. Lively's image suffered, straining the bond. Swift is now focused on Travis Kelce. Lively seeks new high-profile connections. The friendship may be over. Both are moving on with their careers and relationships.

title: Penguins quash Crosby trade rumors, vow to keep their captain
content: Amidst swirling trade rumors linking Sidney Crosby to teams like the Colorado Avalanche and Montreal Canadiens, the Pittsburgh Penguins have firmly stated their captain will not be traded. Despite speculation fueled by the Penguins' current standing and comments from some insiders, Crosby's agent and close friend have refuted the claims.

title: Seth Rollins hurt in shocking accident at WWE Saturday night’s main event
content: Seth Rollins sustained a legitimate knee injury during a match against LA Knight at Saturday Night’s Main Event, potentially halting his momentum. The incident occurred while Rollins attempted a Moonsault, landing awkwardly after Knight moved. The match was cut short, with Knight picking up the win. Rollins, who has a history of knee issues, was assisted backstage.

title: 'Sootra ko hum mootra samajhte hain', Tejashwi mocks 'illegal voters' claim
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav dismissed reports of illegal migrants from Bangladesh, Nepal, and Myanmar being registered as voters in Bihar, questioning the credibility of the sources. He accused the BJP-led NDA of being responsible for any dubious names on voter lists, calling the Election Commission's special intensive revision (SIR) an "eyewash.

title: IND vs ENG: 'I said 100 before lunch ...': Rahul breaks silence on Pant run-out
content: KL Rahul's century at Lord's was overshadowed by Rishabh Pant's unfortunate run-out, which Rahul admitted was partly due to his push for the milestone before lunch. Their 141-run partnership showcased contrasting styles, with Rahul's steady approach complementing Pant's aggressive flair. Despite the setback, Rahul praised Pant's solid performance and expressed regret over the missed opportunity for both to excel.

title: FBI arrests 8 Indian-origin men: Khalistani-linked fugitive held; assault rifle, bullets seized
content: The FBI, in collaboration with local law enforcement, apprehended Pavittar Singh Batala, a fugitive linked to Babbar Khalsa International, in California. The arrest, part of 'Summer Heat' initiative, also led to the capture of seven others and the seizure of a significant cache of weapons and ammunition. Batala faces charges related to organized crime, with Indian agencies seeking his extradition.

title: 'I'd play rugby with that': Broad ridicules Dukes ball as shape controversy erupts
content: Stuart Broad has ignited a debate regarding the quality of the Dukes ball used in the India vs England Test series, expressing his dissatisfaction with the rejected balls from the Lord's Test. He criticized the balls for losing shape quickly, rendering them ineffective for both bowlers and batters, impacting the game's overall quality and playing conditions.

title: Student sets self ablaze over 'harassment': Odisha govt to bear medical expenses
content: In Odisha, a college student's self-immolation after alleged ignored sexual harassment complaints prompted swift action. The state government pledged to cover medical expenses and formed a high-level committee for investigation. The accused HoD and Principal have been suspended, and the accused teacher is now in police custody, with initial evidence supporting the student's claims.

title: 'Rs 3 lakh to Rs 11 lakh': Protest in Mumbai after BJP MLA offers bounty on priests
content: Thousands of Christians protested in Mumbai against BJP MLA Gopichand Padalkar's alleged threats inciting violence against those involved in religious conversions. The community demands Padalkar's resignation and an FIR, while also expressing concern over a proposed anti-conversion law. Demonstrations occurred statewide, with leaders calling for protection and action against hate speech.

title: Shukla returns from ISS on Tuesday; mother prepares 'grand welcome'
content: India eagerly awaits the return of its first astronaut, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, from the International Space Station. His Dragon spacecraft is set to undock on Monday, with a Pacific Ocean splashdown expected Tuesday. Shukla's family in Lucknow is preparing a grand welcome, with his mother planning his favorite home-cooked meals.

title: Bloodstained car, no trace of owner: Intel cop missing for 4 days; search operation on
content: A Punjab Police constable from the state intelligence department, Satinder Singh, has been missing since Tuesday night, prompting a large-scale search operation. His car was found near Bhanra village in Patiala, bearing bloodstains, raising concerns about his safety.

title: AI171 crash: At what stage did engines lose thrust? Pilots flag ambiguities
content: Pilots express concerns and skepticism regarding the AAIB report on the AI-171 incident, questioning the timing of engine shutdowns and the failure of the emergency locator transmitter. They highlight ambiguities in the report, the lack of transparency in the investigation, and the exclusion of experienced pilots from the investigation team.

title: Bihar SIR: Nepalese, Bangladeshis found in voter list; names to be excluded from final list
content: Election Commission officials in Bihar have identified numerous individuals from Nepal, Bangladesh, and Myanmar during voter list revisions. This verification process aims to exclude illegal migrants from the electoral roll, with citizenship status checks beginning in August.

title: 'Finger pointing and ... ': KP on Shubman Gill-Zak Crawley drama at Lord's
content: Tensions flared during the final moments of Day 3 in the India-England Test at Lord's, with Jasprit Bumrah and Zak Crawley at the center of a heated exchange. Shubman Gill and other Indian players engaged in verbal sparring with Crawley, prompting intervention from Ben Duckett. Kevin Pietersen supported the aggression, adding spice to the already intense series.

title: Kanwar Yatra: SC to hear plea challenging UP's directive to display QR
content: The Supreme Court is scheduled to review a petition on July 15 challenging the Uttar Pradesh government's directive for QR code displays at businesses along the 'kanwar' path, revealing owner identities. Academic Apoorvanand Jha and others filed the public interest litigation, alleging discriminatory profiling. The court had previously suspended similar orders from BJP-led states, citing privacy concerns for shop owners.

title: Gisele Bündchen’s tearful interview: Healing after Tom Brady divorce
content: Gisele Bundchen spoke about her divorce from Tom Brady in March 2024. She described it as the death of her dream. Bundchen dismissed media claims that Brady's return to football caused the split. She expressed continued support for Brady's happiness and success. Bundchen is focusing on her own truth and has grown close to Joaquim Valente.

title: WWE Saturday night’s: Gunther beats Goldberg, LA Knight defeats Seth Rollins
content: Saturday Night's Main Event witnessed thrilling encounters, including Randy Orton's victory over Drew McIntyre aided by Jelly Roll's ringside presence. Solo Sikoa retained his title amidst controversy, while LA Knight triumphed over an injured Seth Rollins. Gunther retained the WWE World Title against Goldberg in a dramatic match, targeting Goldberg's knee and involving his son, Gage.

title: Aaron Rodgers at war, clash with Steelers coaches called 'a mistake'
content: Hall of Famer Jerome Bettis is concerned about the Pittsburgh Steelers' potential identity shift after acquiring Aaron Rodgers and DK Metcalf. Bettis emphasizes the importance of maintaining a run-first approach, despite Rodgers' preference for a pass-heavy offense. The clash between Rodgers' style and offensive coordinator Arthur Smith's ground-focused scheme raises questions about the team's future success.

title: India's Russian oil imports hit 11-month high in June: Report
content: India's crude oil imports from Russia surged to an 11-month high in June, reaching 2.08 million bpd, driven by refiners bolstering inventories amid geopolitical tensions. While India's overall crude imports decreased, Russian volumes increased, with three refineries processing over half of these imports and exporting refined products.

title: Shubman Gill vs Zak Crawley: 'We call it Tamasha' - Ex-India coach
content: The Lord's test witnessed heated exchanges between India and England, sparked by Zak Crawley's time-wasting tactics before stumps on Day 3, drawing Shubman Gill's ire. Ravi Shastri defended the on-field 'tamasha,' deeming it acceptable as long as boundaries aren't crossed. Tim Southee countered, pointing out India's own time-delaying instances during the match, adding fuel to the already fiery contest.

title: Amarnath Yatra: Three buses collide in Kulgam; 10 pilgrims injured
content: A convoy of buses carrying Amarnath Yatra pilgrims met with an accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district. The incident occurred on Sunday. At least ten pilgrims sustained injuries. They were immediately shifted to a nearby hospital. The injured are now in stable condition. Damaged buses were replaced and the remaining yatris resumed their journey.

title: ‘She pushed me into river’: Murder bid? Man accuses wife after dramatic rescue in Karnataka
content: A man was rescued from the Krishna River near Garjapur after allegedly being pushed by his wife. Sooraj claimed Neethu pushed him while taking photos on a bridge. High water levels swept him away, but locals rescued him using ropes in a two-hour operation. Neethu denied the accusations, and the couple left together without filing a complaint.

title: 'Not for aggression': Pak PM Sharif plays it down; denies nuclear escalation during Op Sindoor
content: Amidst escalating tensions, Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif has dismissed nuclear exchange possibilities with India, asserting their nuclear program is for peace and defense. This follows alleged Pakistani "nuclear blackmails," which India vowed to counter bilaterally. Tensions rose further after India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty, prompting Pakistan to threaten retaliation.

title: Missed call to murder: Lover kills woman over marriage threat in UP
content: A fatal love affair, sparked by a missed call, ended in murder in Balrampur. Ragini, 20, was found dead, and her lover, Vinod Kumar, confessed to strangling her. He claimed she threatened him with rape charges for refusing marriage after he discovered she was already married.

title: Stock market this week: Key factors expected to influence D-Street
content: Indian markets concluded the week with losses exceeding 1%, influenced by global tariff uncertainties and a tepid start to Q1 earnings. The Nifty50 breached its 20-day EMA, signaling potential consolidation. Investors will closely monitor upcoming Q1 earnings from major companies and key inflation data from India and the US for future direction.

title: Another Bihar shocker: BJP leader shot dead; week after bizman Gopal Khemka’s murder
content: In Bihar's Sheikhpura district, BJP leader Surendra Kewat was fatally shot by unidentified assailants, adding to the escalating concerns over law and order. This incident occurred shortly after the murder of businessman Gopal Khemka in Patna. Tejashwi Yadav, an RJD leader, criticized the NDA government's handling of the situation following the recent violence.

title: Epstein case: Musk targets Trump again; asks US president to 'release the files as promised'
content: Elon Musk, the estranged ally of Donald Trump, has publicly urged the former president to release the "Epstein Files," following Trump's Truth Social post on the matter. Musk's demand comes after the DOJ and FBI concluded their investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death, denying any murder or the existence of a client list.

title: ‘Sorry ma’: Vijay protests DMK-era lock-up deaths; demands aid for all victims’ families
content: Actor Vijay, leader of TVK, protested against lock-up deaths during the DMK's governance in Tamil Nadu. The protest, held in Chennai, saw slogans raised against the government. Vijay demanded an apology and compensation for the families of the victims. He criticized Chief Minister M K Stalin's handling of the issue. Vijay assured support to the victim's families.

title: Delhi-Mumbai Expressway crash: 4 dead, 10 injured as minibus hits truck
content: A tragic collision on the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway in Kota district resulted in the deaths of four family members from Karoli, Rajasthan, including a mother, her two sons, and her son-in-law. The traveller they were in rammed into a truck, also injuring ten others.

title: Tripura girl goes missing in Delhi, CM Saha instructs police to take appropriate action
content: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha gave necessary instructions to the police to take immediate and appropriate action on the matter.

title: Ex-BJP leader Surendra Kumar, local businessman shot dead in separate incidents in Bihar
content: Opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav slams the State Government over poor law and order and calls both the BJP Deputy Chief Ministers “useless”

title: Seventh edition of Huddle Global Start-up festival to be held in Kovalam in December
content: The conclave this year is set to draw thousands of participants representing over 15 countries, promising a bigger global gathering that celebrates start-up culture

title: On centenary year, Kakori train action to be celebrated in grand manner in Lucknow: Rajnath Singh
content: My effort will be to celebrate the centenary year of the Kakori incident in a grand manner in the city as well as other places, says Defence Minister Rajnath Singh

title: New butterfly species, Zographetus mathewi, discovered in Western Ghats
content: Zographetus mathewi is part of the Zographetus satwa species-group, characterised by unique features such as wing venation patterns and secondary sexual traits, including swollen forewing veins in males

title: From hotel cancellation to loss of baggage, Ahmedabad air crash victims opted for array of insurance
content: The incident has triggered claims under various insurance categories like travel, personal accident, and life insurance, including those from Kisan Credit Card holders

title: Power struggle escalates at Kerala University: V-C seeks control over file movement
content: Vice-Chancellor issues a directive to senior university officials, including Joint Registrar, not to process or forward any documents signed by Registrar

title: Election Commission of India activates field machinery for possible pan-India voter list revision from next month
content: Election Commission of India prepares for nationwide intensive review of electoral rolls to remove illegal foreign migrants, starting with Bihar

title: Accessing Jarawa one of the oldest surviving hunter-gather tribes for census will not be tough: Experts
content: The Government has formally announced that the 16th Census of India will take place in two phases, with the reference dates set as March 1, 2027, for most of the country and October 1, 2026

title: Three boys drown in pond in Ranipet
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the boys went to the pond to take bath despite no knowledge of swimming

title: Seized weapons show Manipur insurgent groups modifying some looted arms into sniper rifles
content: Officials say the weapons have been converted into makeshift sniper rifles to target opposing communities

title: Student-led study offers hope for paddy revival
content: A study by Architha Manoj and Jyothika Krishna reveals that Effective Microorganism -treated rice seeds enhance crop growth and also significantly improve soil health

title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests seven Indian fishermen from Rameswaram
content: Another trawler was damaged by the Sri Lankan Navy’s patrol boat while fishing in the area between Katchatheevu and Neduntheevu

title: ED arrests 2 in money-laundering case against Sahara Group
content: The individuals taken into custody have been identified as Vailaparampil Abraham and Jitendra Prasad Verma

title: Plea filed in SC against U.P. govt's QR code directive for eateries along 'kanwar' route
content: The petition said the U.P. government's directive asking stall owners to reveal religious and caste identities under "lawful license requirements" breaches the right to privacy of the shop, dhaba, and restaurant owners.

title: Gogoi seeks Centre’s intervention for uninterrupted connectivity to Barak Valley
content: Congress MP flags chronic transport disruptions, urges time-bound infrastructure roadmap for region’s 40 lakh residents

title: Four killed in accident on Bengaluru-Mysuru highway
content: The driver, who was reportedly overspeeding, lost control and crashed into the parapet wall. Due to the impact, the car overturned and was heavily damaged.

title: AI-171 crew acted in line with responsibility under challenging conditions: AI Pilots’ grouping ICPA
content: Strongly rejecting insinuations in some quarters about pilot suicide, the association representing narrow-body pilots of Air India stressed that until the official investigation is concluded and the final report is published, any speculation is unacceptable and must be condemned.

title: Tribal woman delivers baby while on doli as ambulance arrives late in Andhra’s Anakapalli district
content: While the family reached the road point the ambulance took time to reach the spot and family members helped the woman deliver a baby

title: MLC Teenmaar Mallanna’s gunman opens fire as Telangana Jagruthi members storm his Hyderabad office
content: MLC Chintapandu Naveen Kumar’s derogatory comments on MLC Kavitha angered the Telangana Jagruthi leaders

title: BMRCL to upgrade depots to support expanding Metro network in Bengaluru
content: In addition to these developments, five new depots are under construction to support the expanding metro network.

title: Election Commission always a 'puppet' in hands of Modi government: Kapil Sibal
content: Kapil Sibal alleged that each election commissioner surpasses the previous one in his "alignment to this government"

title: 5 held for thrashing Dalit teen, hurling casteist abuses in U.P.’s Muzaffarnagar
content: A case has been registered against the five people from Badhai Kala village in Muzaffarnagar district for beating up Gullu

title: Andhra Pradesh Government issues revised guidelines for building permissions under self-certification scheme
content: “The SCS is aimed at ‘revolutionising building permissions’ for enhanced Ease and Speed of Doing Business, and boosting the real estate sector,” an official said

title: Dharmasthala burial case: Dakshina Kannada police to ascertain stand of complainant, advocates on changing investigating officer or handing over case to SIT
content: Dharmasthala police also booked a case against YouTuber M.D. Sameer on July 11 for providing false and fictitious information on the burial case to the public through his channel

title: IIM-Calcutta ‘rape’: Woman’s father claims no such incident took place
content: The student’s lawyer claimed before the court that IIM-Calcutta, situated at Joka on the southern outskirts of Kolkata, is a secure place with restricted entry, asserting that there was something amiss in the accusation

title: Amid reports of Jayant Patil’s resignation, NCP (SP) to hold meet on July 15
content: Reports in a section of media have claimed NCP (SP) Maharashtra unit chief Jayant Patil has resigned from the post and that party MLC Shashikant Shinde will take over from him

title: Auto-rickshaw driver thrashed by Sena (UBT) workers over 'anti-Marathi' remarks; video goes viral
content: The auto-rickshaw driver, a migrant residing in the Virar area of Palghar, had allegedly made derogatory remarks against the Marathi language, Maharashtra and Marathi icons

title: My brother had confessed to killing his daughter: Slain tennis player Radhika Yadav's uncle
content: Talking to reporters in Gurugram, Vijay Yadav, the elder brother of Deepak Yadav, also categorically denied that Radhika Yadav had a tennis academy

title: Raj, Uddhav alliance needed to give new direction to Maharashtra: Sanjay Raut
content: Mr. Raut also claimed the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has nothing to do with the fight for Maharashtra's unity and Marathi "asmita" (pride)

title: "Six Hour Notice, No Safety Assurance": Inside America's New Deportation Plan
content: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is reportedly planning to deport migrants with as little as six hours of advance notice to countries that are not their own-- even without any guarantees of safety from the receiving nations.

title: Man Arrested For Posting AI-Generated Pornographic Videos Of Assam Woman Online
content: A man has been arrested in Assam's Tinsukia district for allegedly morphing photographs and creating AI-generated pornographic videos of a woman and circulating those on social media and also profiting from it, the police said on Sunday.

title: "Won't Spare Anyone": Brother Of Odisha Student Who's Fighting For Her Life
content: A day after a girl student from Odisha set herself on fire over inaction on her complaint of sex harrasment against a professor, her brother told NDTV he "will go to any length" to ensure she gets justice.

title: "Feel Like Failure": Missing Delhi University Student's Family Finds A Note
content: The disappearance of a 19-year-old Delhi University student, whose last known location was the Signature Bridge, has put the spotlight on the gaps in CCTV coverage of the national capital's streets

title: Rats Drank 800 Bottles Of Liquor? Dhanbad Traders' Bizarre Cover-Up Attempt
content: Such is the rat race for corruption that even the humble rat cannot maintain a clean image. In Jharkhand's Dhanbad, traders unable to explain missing stocks of Indian Made Foreign Liquor have accused rats of drinking from about 800 bottles.

title: J&K Governor Hands Job Orders To Terrorism Victims In Baramulla
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lt Governor Manoj Sinha said on Sunday that although the Constitution of the country guarantees freedom of expression, it does not mean those glorifying terrorism through speeches and statements can go scot-free.

title: Army Denies Drone Strikes On Insurgent Group ULFA-I Camp In Myanmar
content: The Indian Army has denied it had carried out drone attacks on the eastern headquarters of the banned insurgent group United Liberation Front of Asom-Independent (ULFA-I) in Myanmar.

title: Delhi Minister Parvesh Verma Inspects Yamuna On Boat, Collects Water Sample For Testing
content: Delhi Irrigation and Flood Control Minister Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma took to the waters of the Yamuna on Saturday morning, conducting a boat survey at Palla, where the river enters Delhi from Haryana.

title: Elon Musk's xAI Apologises For Grok's Horrific Anti-Semitic Slurs
content: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, apologised Saturday after its chatbot Grok generated a series of antisemitic and Hitler-glorifying posts on X earlier this week.

title: Blog: Blog | Witch, Warrior, Woman: Radhika Apte Is Done Playing Nice
content: Apte is a phenomenon - an actor whose range, though often confined to the thematic corridors of thriller and horror, quietly defies the limitations imposed by the very industry that should champion her.

title: Minister Alleges 1,000 Non-Hindus On Tirumala Temple Board's Payroll, Seeks Action
content: Union Minister and prominent Telangana BJP leader, Bandi Sanjay Kumar, has ignited a fresh controversy by alleging that more than 1,000 non-Hindus are currently employed within the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams.

title: "Wife Kept Eloping, I Stayed Silent": Assam Man Bathes In Milk After Divorce
content: Manik Ali captured the entire celebration on camera and can be heard announcing, "I am free from today."

title: 9-Member Special Team To Investigate IIM-Calcutta Rape Case
content: Police have constituted a nine-member special investigation team (SIT) to probe into the alleged rape of a woman by a student at the Indian Institute of Management-Calcutta, officials said on Saturday.

title: "A Sorry Model Government": TVK Chief Slams DMK Over 'Custodial' Deaths
content: Actor-politician and Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief Vijay on Sunday led a massive protest in Chennai, seeking justice for Ajith Kumar, a private security guard who died in police custody due to alleged torture.

title: "Air India Crash Report Unclear On Who Made Decisions": Pilots' Federation
content: President of the Federation of Indian Pilots, Charanvir Singh Randhawa, on Sunday raised doubts over the preliminary report on the Air India AI171 crash.

title: How Pakistani Handlers Used A Popular Mobile Game To Target Rajasthan Man
content: Sohail was arrested in September last year, and the chargesheet filed by Rajasthan's Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has revealed details not just about Sohail but also foreign-linked online networks that are targeting Indians,

title: "What A Shame": Omar Abdullah Slams House Arrests On Kashmir Martyrs' Day
content: Several ministers in the Omar Abdullah-led Jammu and Kashmir government, MLAs and top leaders of the ruling party and the Opposition were put under house arrest or detained to prevent them from observing Kashmir Martyrs' Day today.

title: Migrant Auto Driver Beaten In Maharashtra Days After "Hindi Bolunga" Remark
content: A migrant auto-rickshaw driver in Maharashtra's Palghar district was assaulted in full public view by supporters of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena (UBT) and Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) after a prior confrontation over Marathi

title: "Mitti, Kajal, Darshan": Chhangur Baba's Code Words For Conversion "Project"
content: Project, mitti palatna, kajal lagana and darshan - these were the code words Jamaluddin alias Chhangur Baba used at various stages to convert one's faith as he lured several people.

title: India Reverses Rule, Eases Sulphur Emission Rules For Coal Power Plants
content: India has reversed a decade-old mandate to install $30 billion worth of clean-air equipment, easing sulphur emission rules for most coal-fired power plants, a government order said.

title: Five militants arrested in Manipur
content: Security personnel also nabbed an active cadre of the outlawed Kangleipak Communist Party (APUNBA) from his residence at Kongpal in Imphal East on Saturday

title: Vijay leads TVK protest against custodial deaths in Tamil Nadu
content: “If courts have to intervene in everything, from the sexual assault of a student at Anna University to the custodial death of Ajith Kumar, what is the role of the Chief Minister and what is the purpose of the government,” he asked.

title: Goa man on run after submitting fake documents for passport nabbed in Chennai
content: The police launched a search using both technical and human intelligence and traced Choure to Chennai, an official said

title: Bihar SIR: People from Nepal, Bangladesh, Myanmar found during drive; will not be included in final voter list, says Election Commission
content: The Bihar SIR began on June 25 and the last date for submitting Enumeration Forms given by Booth Level Officers to voters is July 25, following which a draft list would be brought out on August 1

title: Himachal govt announces ₹2 crore each for constituencies severely affected by rains
content: So far, since the onset of monsoon on June 20 till July 11, Himachal Pradesh has suffered losses of ₹751 crore

title: When Afghan children spoke in Malayalam to Kerala’s General Education Minister V. Sivankutty
content: The family from Kabul moved to Thiruvananthapuram in 2021 when Mr. Shafiq Rahimi joined the Department of Economics of the University of Kerala as a Research Scholar in Economics

title: In Frames: Stampede country
content: As the world marks Population Day and India prepares for its population count, a look at the multiple tragedies across the country that were triggered by overwhelming crowds and the lack of adequate safety and control measures

title: Uttarakhand Police arrest woman; recover MDMA drugs worth ₹10 crore near India-Nepal border
content: The SP said the woman was arrested and a case was registered against her under the relevant Sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act

title: Star of Mysore editor K.B. Ganapathy passes away
content: The last rites are scheduled to be held at the crematorium at the foot of Chamundi Hills on July 13 evening.

title: CPP leader Sonia Gandhi calls meeting on July 15 to finalise Congress strategy for Monsoon session of Parliament
content: Opposition parties are expected to raise strong concerns over the Election Commission's move to carry out a Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar

title: Kota Srinivasa Rao passes away: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu, Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan offer condolences
content: CM Chandrababu Naidu said Srinivasa Rao’s artistic contributions to the fields of cinema and theatre for nearly four decades and the roles he portrayed were unforgettable

title: Muslims doctors in nine medical colleges in Bengal stands at 6.6%; RTI enquiries reveal
content: Murshidabad Medical College and Hospital recorded highest number of Muslim doctors at 19.56%  and Purulia’s Deben Mahato Hospital and Medical College recorded lowest % Muslim doctors at 1.82%. Muslim population in West Bengal stands at 27.01 %

title: Former Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy condemns attack on Zilla Parishad chairperson Uppala Harika
content: Jagan Mohan Reddy alleged that the incident was proof of a collapse of basic security and breakdown of governance and public safety in Andhra Pradesh

title: JMM's official X handle hacked by anti-social elements: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren
content: Mr. Soren is currently in Delhi in connection with his father and JMM founder Shibu Soren's treatment

title: Kasab prosecutor Ujjwal Nikam to former diplomat Shringla — a look at the four nominees for Rajya Sabha
content: In a notification issued on Saturday (July 12, 2025) The Union Home Ministry said the President nominated the four to fill the vacancies caused due to retirement of nominated members

title: Wagon of freight train carrying fuel catches fire near Tiruvallur railway station
content: The fire and rescue services personnel were involved in dousing the fire for more than two hours even as overhead power supply for electric trains were cut off as safety precaution

title: President nominates Kerala BJP veteran C. Sadanandan to the Rajya Sabha
content: The lower primary school teacher had contested as the BJP candidate from the Koothuparambu constituency in the 2021 Kerala legislative Assembly elections

title: Leaders of J&K regional parties ‘detained, locked in homes’ in Srinagar on anniversary of civilians killed in 1931
content: The J&K police on Saturday had warned of action against those who head for the shrine located in the old city in Srinagar

title: President Murmu nominates four to Rajya Sabha, including former Foreign Secretary Shringla, 26/11 prosecutor Nikam
content: The President of India nominates 12 persons as her nominees to the Rajya Sabha, four seats are currently vacant.

title: Amarnath Yatra: Fresh batch of over 7,000 pilgrims leave from Jammu base camp
content: The 38-day annual pilgrimage to the 3,880-metre high cave shrine started from the two routes on July 3 and is scheduled to end on August 9

title: Four sustain injuries in wild elephant attack in Kozhikode
content: According to the police, Santha and Sanika were chased by the elephant while they were on their way to a nearby field with their cows

title: Arya Vaidya Sala trustee Raghava Varier passes away
content: Varier is survived by wife Lakshmi Varasiar, son P.R. Ramesh, and daughter Usha. The funeral took place at Kottakkal

title: Special trains from Cherlapalli to Tirupati
content: SCR has shifted several trains to Cherlapalli because of the ongoing Secunderabad station redeveloped works

title: Agniveer recruitment rally at 1 EME Centre in Secunderabad on August 1
content: Applicants must be between 17½ and 21 years of age, with birth dates falling between October 1, 2004, and April 1, 2008

title: Air India Ahmedabad plane crash: U.S. Golden Chassis helped AAIB download raw data from black box
content: AAIB said the Golden Chassis or the identical EAFR unit and download cables required to download data from EAFR were sourced from the U.S. National Transport Safety Board (NTSB)

title: Primary teachers in Andhra Pradesh seek payment of pending arrears
content: The government must constitute Pay Revision Commission and announce Interim Relief without further delay, says A.P. Primary Teachers Association

title: Wife living separately from husband without valid reason not entitled to maintenance: Allahabad HC
content: The counsel for the petitioner submitted that the trial court has recorded the finding that the wife is living separately from her husband without sufficient reasons

title: The peopling of the Indian subcontinent
content: According to the 2011 Census, inter-caste marriages were about 6% and inter-faith ones about 1%. It is likely these numbers will have risen significantly when the forthcoming 2027 Census offers the numbers

title: EAM Jaishankar to tour Singapore, China from July 13
content: In Singapore, Mr. Jaishankar will meet his counterpart and the leadership of the country as part of the regular exchanges between the two sides.

title: Five Municipal Corporations in A.P. win Swachh Survekshan Awards 2025
content: The civic bodies in Vijayawada, Guntur and Tirupati grab the award in population category, while Vizag and Rajahmundry win in ministerial category

title: Foreign Medical Graduates get relief as A.P. High Court asks APMC to issue PR to appellant
content: APMC shall grant PR to the appellant as he has completed the one-year mandatory internship as specified in CRMI Regulations, 2021, says Division Bench

title: Jagan accuses Naidu of suppressing dissent with State machinery
content: The fundamental democratic process is being crushed under the weight of an authoritarian regime, alleges the YSRCP chief

title: A.P. Endowments Minister discusses TTD staff issues with Trust Board
content: Renovation works have been sanctioned for over 200 temples, utilising the Common Good Fund, says Ramanarayana Reddy

title: BJP MP’s remarks on pregnant woman’s demand for motorable road to village in M.P. stir row
content: Rajesh Mishra courted controversy after accusing the woman from his constituency of seeking social media fame, while also offering to make arrangements for her delivery

title: How is Mizoram handling the refugee crisis?
content: Who are the Chins? What led to the fresh inflow? What ties does the dominant Mizo community of Mizoram share with the Chins of Myanmar, the Bawms of Bangladesh, and the Kuki-Zos of Manipur? How are foreigners identified in the State?

title: Air India says will review preliminary plane crash report with pilots
content: Initial report an important step in identifying factors and ensuring prevention measures, says AI’s communication

title: What is the state of inequality in India?
content: Why is calculating the actual level of income and wealth inequality in India extremely difficult? What are the methods? Does the picture of low and falling inequality as outlined by the World Bank characterise the current reality of India? Where is wealth concentrated in India?

title: ICG, Japan Coast Guard conclude joint exercise ‘JA-MATA’ off Chennai coast
content: The ship undertook this visit to gain exposure to international maritime operations and enhance cooperation between the Indian Coast Guard (ICG) and JCG, says ICG

title: One more Nipah case in Kerala as patient dies at Perinthalmanna hospital
content: The man hailing from Kumaramputhur, near Mannarkkad, in Palakkad district was under treatment at the hospital for fever-related ailments

title: Rain brings respite from heat in Vellore, nearby districts
content: Tiruvannamalai district receives the highest amount of rain since Thursday night, with 19.20 mm, followed by Tirupattur with 13.10 mm

title: Police deny permission to J&K parties, including NC, to visit slain civilians’ graveyard of 1931 uprising in Srinagar
content: Any violation of these orders shall invite strict legal action under relevant provisions of law, the police has warned; several regional parties had sought permission to be allowed to visit the graveyard located on the premises of Naqsband Sahib shrine in the old city

title: Sinner vs. Alcaraz: Who will win the Wimbledon title?
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner will face off for the second time in a major final, at Wimbledon on Sunday. Our experts make predictions.

title: Browns' Judkins facing domestic violence charge
content: Cleveland Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins was arrested on a domestic violence and battery charge in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, on Saturday, according to the Fort Lauderdale Police Department and Broward County arrest records.

title: Sources: Anthony bought out, looks to join Bucks
content: Cole Anthony agreed to a contract buyout with the Memphis Grizzlies, and the 25-year-old guard plans to sign with the Milwaukee Bucks after he clears waivers, sources told ESPN on Saturday night.

title: Stevenson keeps belt with decision win vs. Zepeda
content: Shakur Stevenson couldn't score a knockout blow against William Zepeda but put together a boxing clinic to retain his WBC lightweight title with a unanimous decision Saturday night in Queens, N.Y.

title: Messi extends historic streak with 2 more goals
content: Lionel Messi extended his MLS-record streak of multigoal games as he scored twice in Inter Miami's win over Nashville.

title: Sharpe, 3-time Pro Bowl LT for Cardinals, dies
content: Longtime Cardinals left tackle Luis Sharpe, a three-time Pro Bowler who spent his entire 13-year NFL career with the franchise, has died at age 65.

title: Harper's Spurs top Flagg's Mavs at summer league
content: The top two choices in the NBA draft, Cooper Flagg and Dylan Harper, faced off Saturday in the NBA summer league, and flashed an enticing view of what might be on the horizon next season during the San Antonio Spurs' 76-69 win over the Dallas Mavericks.

title: Roberts, Murphy back Misiorowski ASG selection
content: The addition of Milwaukee Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski to the NL All-Star team drew mixed reactions around baseball, but on Saturday, NL manager Dave Roberts supported the selection, adding the rookie should bring "some more excitement" to the game.

title: FIFA, players agree to mandatory rest periods
content: Player unions secured an apparent victory in their battle for mandatory rest periods after a meeting in New York with FIFA president Gianni Infantino.

title: MLB mock draft 3.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first two rounds
content: The MLB draft is Sunday! And this year, the drama starts with the Washington Nationals at the No. 1 pick.

title: Who are the NFL's best offensive tackles? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Who are the best offensive tackles in the NFL? We asked execs, coaches and scouts to rank their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: How Chelsea, PSG compare; who will win?
content: One of Chelsea or PSG will win the first expanded Club World Cup on Sunday, so how do they match up ahead of the final?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Rashford nears Man United exit as Barcelona lay out terms
content: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford is increasingly likely to join Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: The unstoppable power of Jim Abbott's legacy
content: Abbott, who pitched in the majors with one hand, remains a beacon for families with unique struggles.

title: Why LeBron and the Lakers are stuck in limbo
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: Gyökeres warned with fines after going on strike
content: Sporting CP president Frederico Varandas has insisted that Viktor Gyökeres will face fines after he went on strike Saturday, refusing to report to the club's preseason training.

title: Slot pays tribute to Jota before Liverpool match
content: Arne Slot has paid an emotional tribute to Diogo Jota ahead of Liverpool's first match since the Portugal forward's death..

title: Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC
content: FIFA President Gianni Infantino said stadiums with roofs will be used to ease concerns over severe weather at the 2026 Men's World Cup.

title: Not done yet: Cazorla, 40, inks new Oviedo deal
content: Santi Cazorla will be back in LaLiga next season after signing a new contract with newly promoted Real Oviedo.

title: LaLiga boss rejects Madrid plea to extend break
content: LaLiga president Javier Tebas rejected Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois' plea to postpone the team's 2025-26 league opener to give players time to rest following the Club World Cup.

title: Louis van Gaal 'no longer bothered by cancer'
content: Louis van Gaal has said he is "no longer bothered by cancer" and is keen for a return to the higher levels of the game.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Sweden demolish Germany, Poland make history
content: Sweden topped Group C with a commanding win over Germany. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.
